title: 16 workers can complete a work in 8 days. In how many days can 4 workers complete it? - Quora

response.answer_text: While the previous answers are also correct they assume it is labor work. I’d love to ask the question what kind of work are we talking about? For example take Software Engineering. It is (and by extension writing code) at its core is about problem solving. There is a funny thing about trying to solve problems: it does not scale linearly. Linear in this case means that for every extra worker thinking about the problem does not mean it will be solved that much faster. In fact there is a common saying “There are too many cooks in the kitchen” which we say when there are a lot of people disagreeing on a solution to a problem. The more engineers you assign to solve the same problem the more diminishing the effect is. For example if you have 2 engineers and you add two more you get more value out of the combined effort of your workers than say you had 6 of them and you add 6 more for a total of 12. What do you do with big problems then? How do we solve those? Much like when you build a house you have to break the problem down and let those problems be solved one after another or at the same time if it is possible. You can’t put the windows in while you are still building the walls but is completely possible to paint the inside and outside at the same time. Fun fact you can apply this to your own things at home too - your life is a big project after all. If you know how to break your problems down to parts you can manage then you’ll have a much easier time with practically anything you need to solve.

16 complete in 8 4 complete in 32 there is an easy way to do it put all the data you have in a table in this way : workers work time 16 1 84 1 xTake care to put the work in the middleThen you multiply 8*1*16=4*1*x like zikzak 8*16=4x x=32

So the work takes 16 x 8 worker days to complete. I.e. it’s a 128 worker-day. So dividing 128 by 4 means it’s takes them 32 days. Watch out though what the work is. If one woman can produce a baby in 9 months. How long will it take 9 women to produce one baby! <g>

16 workers can complete a work in 8 days. In how many days can 4 workers complete it? The question does not contain enough information to answer. If “the work” requires more than 4 workers working together, then 4 workers can never complete the job.

It is a very easy question but for a begineer it is difficult to think  ( telling myself) Let us suppose total man days is 16 workers * 8 days = 128 man days Means they did 16 work in 1 day So 4 work did the same work in ? 128/4 = 32 days.

16 workers times 8 days = 128 worker-days 128 worker-days / 4 workers = 32 days Thus 4 workers would need 32 days to complete the “work”, assuming all the workers are equally efficient and work the same number of hours per day.

Original work schedule is 16 workers take 8 days to complete task = 128 person days.Revised work schedule is 4 workers (128 ÷ 4 = 32 person days) will take 32 days for each worker to complete work task.
Technically, 32 days. However, if it required 16 workers the first time then chances are 4 alone cannot complete it. Most companies dont hire unnecessary employees.
16 men complete in 8 days 1 men completes in 8*16 4 men complete work in 8*16/4=32 Therefore 32 days take to complete.
The work needs 16*8 = 128 worker-days. So 4 workers will take 128 worker-days/4 workers = 32 days.
128 work days are needed hence 4 workers take 32 days in theory!
